items.sentence: I wonder if there\'s a chance Tom will be here tomorrow.
People tell you a lot of things that aren\'t quite true.
Tom and Mary gave their mother flowers on Mother\'s Day.
You\'ve given three copies of the report to Tom already.
Tom said he wanted to live in a French-speaking country.
Tom didn\'t know who Mary was planning to see in Boston.
The party we\'ve been invited to is tomorrow, not today.
I heard Tom\'s car drive up, but he hasn\'t come in yet.
Tom isn\'t used to driving on the left side of the road.
Why didn\'t you tell me you didn\'t know how to do this?
Why don\'t you wait here while I finish what I\'m doing?
If this story doesn\'t interest you, go on to Chapter 2.
Tom won\'t be able to finish the job unless we help him.
Tom\'s heart stopped, but doctors managed to revive him.
I just don\'t know why Tom doesn\'t want me to help him.
Tom likes you too, Mary. He\'s just too shy to admit it.
Washing dishes is something I don\'t really enjoy doing.
We can\'t afford to spend any more time waiting for Tom.
Didn\'t you know Tom lived in Australia for a long time?
Tom was the one who thought that we should take a break.
